text: are there any docs for creating a plugin provider?
I was going to try to use ipmi and VirtualBMC with my libvirt vm's but I just realized it was licensed only when I tried to install it.
So I was thinking maybe a simple plugin provider that would enable running commands on the machines via ssh
<@UF1LXSN15> - we have one.  kvm-test.  We haven’t productized it but <@U02DJQSG8> uses it for testing with KVM/libvirt on his setup.
so for internal use only then?
Eh, more like "you need to be me to use it anyways".
well I code so if there were an example or docs on how to create a plugin provider I should be able to hack something together to do what I'm wanting
there's an example under /cmd for the incrementer plugin in the provision repo

attachments.title: digitalrebar/provision
attachments.text: Digital Rebar Provision is a simple and powerful Golang executable that provides a complete API-driven DHCP/PXE/TFTP provisioning system. - digitalrebar/provision

text: I'm about (next few days) to update the license flow to so any registered user can use plugins - it will not require creating an org.  Makes it even more self service.
thanks <@U02DHRR2L>.  That's what I needed!  I'll see what I can get going.
<@UF1LXSN15> in the mean time, I can create an org for you so that you can get started now... I'll send you info via DM
just created <https://github.com/digitalrebar/provision-content/pull/181> , hope it helps to make krib ha more usable :slightly_smiling_face: works for me
